reviews.review_msg: Tests were fair and expectation was clearly communicated. Lecture slides are good, contain enough info, you don't need to furiously take notes during lectures. Speaks slowly, so I watched the recording at 1.4x speed. Really advocated for us to the IT dept. to have the lecture recordings available. Good at explaining things esp. during office hours.

Dr.Pio is by far one of the most unbearable teachers I've ever had. His accent makes it far too difficult to understand during lecture and his monotone voice doesn't help that cause. Tests are solely based off lecture content so there's no point in showing up. Just study his slides and you'll do fine. Definitely prepare to teach yourself

yes he has a heavy French accent but his tests are identical to what you learn in the lecture slides/practice tests/tutorial worksheets. We did have to purchase a textbook but I did not read it and got close to 100% on all my tests just by studying the slides. 3 quizzes a week online, open book, like 3-7 questions. 
Tests are all non cumulative :D

Professor Pio was a nice guy, but clearly not interested in teaching. He seemed bored by the material, read in a monotone voice and basically read straight from the slides. The best way I can describe his extremely heavy accent is that it felt like I had the subtitles in front of me and yet still couldn't decipher what he was trying to say.

Exams were very fair. Final exam was cumulative but manageable as he gave many hints during review sessions. He was very accessible for extra help. He will explain concepts over and over again until he is convinced you actually understand.

Virtually impossible to understand and not at all any more helpful during his office hours. Exams are reasonable other than the 2 questions he'll teach incorrectly or take from lectures that aren't supposed to be included. One of the worst professors I've ever had.

Good luck trying to understand him. Attend lectures for the iclickers and self-teach the rest. Follow the SLOs on the lecture slides and look at diagrams in the textbook to do well on the exams. His practice exams are very similar to the midterms and finals. Overall not a very tough prof if you can learn the material on your own.
The midterm & final are from the notes Very fair. Very knowledgeable & the accent youll get used to I. A few days

Don't know why everyone hates on him so much, he isn't the most interesting prof and he has an accent but he doesn't deserve all the flack that he gets. He's a nice guy and exams are relatively easy, plus they're marked fair. He tries many times to be engaging, it's just that most people in this course(myself included) don't care much about MBB..
He is the worst port I have ever seen.

He has a thick French accent but you eventually get used to it. Not as bad as people say, though not great either. Lectures are boring but the material he covers in class is usually the stuff that will show up on quizzes or midterms.

He's not THAT bad of a professor as people say. The accent - you'll get used to after a week. His lectures are boring but the midterm and final were straight from his notes. His quizzes are not hard either, you just have to read the textbook and teach yourself what material is relevant from it by looking at his learning outcomes.

exams and quizzes ridiculously hard. he does not test main concepts. make sure you know random, small details because that is what is going to be on the exams. you do not need to show up to lectures, you will not be able to understand him. read the textbook. only way you will learn
Terrible prof, can't understand him, only reason to go to lecture is for participation mark. He has a thick french accent, only way to learn is from the textbook. Lecture slides are terrible
Mbb 201? More like French 201. Lectures only mandatory due to iclickers and quizzes.
